title: Amenorrhea
summary: Amenorrhea is the absence of a menstrual period in a woman of reproductive age.[1] Physiological states of amenorrhoea are seen, most commonly, during pregnancy and lactation (breastfeeding), the latter also forming the basis of a form of contraception known as the lactational amenorrhoea method. Outside the reproductive years, there is absence of menses during childhood and after menopause.
